Adult.description: Bank Swallows have a forked tail, unlike Northern Rough-winged Swallows which have square-tipped tail. Bank Swallows also glide with a more obvious bend in the wings than rough-winged.

Adult male.description: Violet-green Swallows have a white patch that wraps up around the rump, whereas the upperparts on Northern Rough-winged Swallows are plain brown.

Juvenile.description: Tree Swallows have a clean white throat, whereas the throat on Northern Rough-winged Swallows is dingy.

Adult.description: Cliff swallows have a cream-colored rump patch that Northern Rough-winged Swallows lack and they have a darker throat than rough-winged.
